(Thanx for reminding me about the bridge console Ks, I almost forgot. Oh, 
IR, Hysteria is loyal to Kluster, and I don't think she'd ever met IR, so it 
would probably help if she got a direct order from Kluster to escort the 
Alliance 'bots out. She is currently the only Maximal in the CF^_^ Oh, 
Hotmail said my e-mails might be delayed, just so everybody knows:P)

Hysteria/Tavatron

Hysteria:

The shields buckled and finally failed under the strain of numerous weapons 
fire. Several missles struck the side of the damaged ship, leaving broken 
armor and charred metal in their wake. The EMP cannon sparked ocassionally 
from the numerous blasts it recieved, and appeared to be offline.

THe bridge doors buckled and groaned slightly from the barrage of close 
range weapons fire. Two autoguns targetted the missles fired within the ship 
toward the shields and fired. The main doorway still seemed to be weakening, 
but if the threat was blasted it might explode.

Hysteria was still despretly trying to reroute engine power when she 
recieved IR's message. Apparently her comm wasn't as damaged as she had 
thought. She returned IR's message with a comm of her own:

"I hope I'm not out of line, but are you sure these 'bots can be trusted? 
And what does commander Kluster have to say about this, if you don't mind my 
asking."

She didn't know how much of her message would be recieved, but she did knoe 
she'd better get a response soon. She was ready to attempt powering up what 
reaminsed of the outer defenses and reactivating the shields if possible, 
all she needed was a few more clicks and she'd be done. However, if IR's 
command was carried through, she would disengage the autoguns and escort the 
'bots out of the base herself.

*****

Tavatron:

Tavatron attempted to dodge Reflector's shots, but caught two in the right 
shoulder and one grazed her left side. She was about to return fire of her 
own, but recieved IR's message just moments before firing. She lowered her 
staff, but still held it in a fighting position before her. Something about 
this didn't seem right. She kept her eyes locked on Reflector, just in case.
